description: A unique square temple located on the summit of an earlier hillfort. Possibly a polygonal shrine nearby. Lewis (1966) suggests a chronology beginning in the mid 3rd CE and ending in the late 4th CE or possibly early 5th CE.
bibliography: Martyn, Blick, Brindle, and et al. “Chanctonbury Ring (West Sussex).” The Rural Settlement of Roman Britain: an online resource, 2015. https://doi.org/10.5284/1030449.
Mitchell, G. S. “Excavations at Chanctonbury Ring, 1909.” Sussex Archaeological Collections 53 (1910): 131 ff.
Rudling, David. “Roman-Period Temples, Shrines, and Religion in Sussex.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
Smith, Alex. “The Fate of Pagan Temples in Sount-East Britain during the Late and Post-Roman Periods.” In Ritual Landscapes of Roman South-East Britain, edited by David Rudling, 2008.
